main event: On February 22nd, 1957, in Riverside, California, two pear-shaped white objects, one above the other, were observed to be stationary for 2-4 minutes. The observation was categorized as ground-visual, and it was concluded to be unidentified, possibly a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical object due to insufficient data for evaluation.
interesting points: The sighting lasted 2-4 minutes, giving ample time for observation.
The report categorizes the objects as possibly balloon, aircraft, or astronomical due to a lack of data for evaluation.
The objects were described as stationary and directly overhead.
The report mentions that without proper wind direction evaluation, the description could resemble that of a weather balloon.
The observation was made by a civilian identified as Mr. Good, 8 miles west of Riverside in Glenhaven.
sighted object: two pear-shaped white objects, one above the other
